title: L'oasis des radicelles
description:
Creation d'un tiers-lieu de rencontre et de partage: ferme pedagogique, foret comestible, initiation aÂ  la permaculture....

Notre objectif est de creer une oasis d'accueil et de partage.
Trois missions:
promouvoir et encourager une simplicite de vie en accord avec l'environnement
favoriser le partage, l'echange et la transmission des savoirs et des pratiques ecologiques et humaines/ethiques en les rendant accessibles au plus grand nombre dans le souci du bien-vivre ensemble
experimenter sur le terrain des reponses alternatives via l'agroecologie et la permaculture.

Valeurs et intentions : Inconsciemment victime, le consommateur est aÃ‚Â  l'evidence le rouage d'une machine qui produit toujours plus, afin que l'on consomme toujours plus. Mais surabondance et bonheur ne vont pas forcement de pair ; parfois meme, ils deviennent antinomiques. La joie de vivre est une valeur supreme a laquelle nous aspirons tous, mais que des milliards ne peuvent offrir...

Aller vers l'equilibre du "vivre simplement", tel est notre objectif commun :

- MOINS et mieux consommer pour lutter contre notre societe de surconsommation.
+ PLUS de simplicite, de naturel, plus de solidarite.

Allegeons nos vies, rendons les joyeuses de simplicite et reconcilions ainsi l'etre et l'avoir.

Loin de nous l'idee de donner des lecons ou de juger mais bien au contraire de profiter de l'experience, de la motivation, des interrogations de chacun pour avancer dans la meme direction. Toutes les bonnes idees et le bonnes volontes sont les bienvenues !

Vie sociale : L'agenda est disponible sur le site de l'asso.

Belgeco
Belgian eco-community network
The Belgian eco-community network BelgEco is a new project aiming to bring together all the different communities in Belgium that strive to be more regenerative than mainstream, socially, economically, culturally and ecologically. We dream of a cohesive network of mutual cooperation for a better world for all living beings. It is our intention that Belgeco will become the Belgian branch of
GEN Europe
, embedded in the
Global Ecovillage Network (GEN)
Would you like to participate more actively or only passively in Belgeco? Contact us!

description:
You are here:
Home
/

/
Kasteel Nieuwenhoven
Kasteel Nieuwenhoven
Setting
:
Rural
Founded
: 2006
Main Language
: Dutch
Other Language
: English
Kasteel Nieuwenhoven is a new and evolving project located on an a 20 Hectare estate consisting of historic buildings (Castle and Farm) surrounded by woodlands, farmland and lakes. In this magical setting a small group of people are experimenting with and discovering ways of living together in harmony with nature and themselves. Living off the land â€“ Permaculture, Forestry and other Ecological ways to self-sufficiency are an important part of the communities activities. Parallel to this are various educational activities which serve to share and spread these skills and approaches with more people as well as generating a modest income . The core vision of the project is â€œthe willingness to live your true greatnessâ€. This vision underlies the various activities and organisations active at the Castle. The Castle serves as a venue for groups and courses and offers guest facilities. It is home to a Permaculture School and a new Communnity Supported Agriculture scheme, relying on the extensive permaculture gardens. The beautiful surroundings make this a specially good place for residential programs and long-staying guests. Most recent of these is the Young Life Art (YLA) Program for young adults.
Many of the buildings on the property are in poor condition or in need of conversion into living quarters; carrying this out and financing the extensive work is one of the communities big challenges.

Main Language

Other Languages
: Dutch, English, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish
Great news! On October 1, 2022, I started an experimental Permavillage. I want to use all the techniques that will allow us to reach 100% local, zero petroleum.
To ensure the sustainability of the Permavillage weâ€™ll produce and recycle everything on site, using permaculture techniques.
We will not use any fossil fuels, including hidden oil, i.e. (1) oil that is needed to extract the minerals and metals needed to make the many objects we use every day, as well as (2) oil used as a raw material such as plastics, synthetic textiles, rubbers, etc.
The aim is to install hives in order to produce 100% organic honey, to grow medicinal plants that are antibiotic, antiviral, etc.; to collect rainwater, to produce/grow (1) our food, (2) wood to cook and heat us, (3) our own seeds and (4) carbon plants to feed the soil.
100% local means that nothing can enter and also that nothing can exit the Permavillage, therefore weâ€™ll have to recycle all our waste. Weâ€™ll produce our heat thanks to the rocket stove technique.

title: Het Abtshof cvRural living and working together
description:
Het Abtshof cv
Rural living and working together

Setting: Rural
Type: Cohousing, Eco Project (Eco Farm, Permaculture Project)
Status: Established
Founded: 2017
Main Language: Dutch
Other Languages: English, French, Spanish, Swedish

In the village center of Borlo (Gingelom) we are developing a social, ecological and future-oriented project: Het Abtshof. We are converting a historic square farm into an intergenerational cohousing with 12 residential units and various common areas such as a large kitchen and hall, workshops, guest rooms, laundry room,â€¦ and plenty of play space for children to grow up. We have the ambition to live, work, share, grow and inspire each other together.

The Abtshof is a housing cooperative and includes, in addition to the buildings, a piece of land of 2 ha with a garden, meadow and agricultural land with a new orchard, 2 greenhouses and vegetable cultivation.

The cooperative owns the whole, the residents are shareholders. This structure allows to create living spaces that are adaptable to any family situation. It is a project in full growth: new input is welcome, co-creation is possible and there is potential to develop activities that fit within the vision. We are thinking of a permaculture agricultural project, farm shop, bakery, woodworking studio, yoga studio, creative studio, beekeeping,â€¦

Membership & Visitors
Current members: 12
Open to new members
Open to visitors

We always provide an introduction period for people who want to come and live here. You can also volunteer to participate via WWOOF. Definitely welcome! Mail us: info@abtshof.be

title: Ferme du bout du mondeCommunity Farm inspired by Deep Adaptation
description:
Ferme du bout du monde
Community Farm inspired by Deep Adaptation

Setting: Urban
Type: Eco Community, Eco Project (Eco Farm, Learning Centre, Permaculture Project, Restoration Site)
Status: Established
Founded: 2020
Main Language: French
Other Languages: English, Luxembourgish

La ferme du bout du monde is an eco-place for a community of residents, an agro-ecology training centre and a permaculture farm in Arlon, Belgium. We are developing our food and energy self-sufficiency, as well as agricultural, craft and artistic activities.

It's a place to live, a place to farm and a place to experiment and put into practice our approach to ecological living.

We cultivate self-sufficiency (in food, energy, finance, intellect, etc.).

We operate under shared governance.

We follow a permaculture design process for the development of the site.

The name "Ferme du bout du monde" (Farm at the end/edge of the world) comes from the fact that, for you, it may be the end of the world, but for us it's above all because we're witnessing the end of the world as we've known it, and we're moving towards something different. It's a tribute to deep adaptation.

At the edge of the world, there is joy, creativity and unimaginable possibilities.

Membership & Visitors

Current members: 6
Open to new members
Open to visitors

Please contact us for more information on joining and being part of the community.

title: Buying a property together in France!?
description:
Surface: 50mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Private unit with shared faciities (2 slaapkamers)
Common parts
Hello...
Are you also tired of paying those expensive / unaffordable exorbitant prices in this Belgian rental market for both renting and buying...
and do you actually want your own place in full ownership, a safe & quiet accommodation for your old age... ,
but you don't have the required budget that they want here in this country, and you like the bit of remoteness abroad,
Well, we're on the same wavelength...
About to buy an old-fashioned (farmhouse style or similar) spacious house in France... (and preferably this summer)...I'm looking for someone (1 @ 2max.), a single person with an alternative lifestyle, who also wants to take this step... but doesn't want to spend too much. this call for the cohousing partner concerns a single male candidate the exact location (municipality / city / village) is less important to us. just the region.
our establishment / settlement must be located in one of the following departments. :/
(Champagne-Ardenne / Lorraine / Vosgez / Alsace / Bourgogne Nord). this is already a very broadly plausible area, where there is sufficient choice ... (but a deviation from this is negotiable)
We also want a permanent residence location, so with a very spacious area, where there is enough space for everyone.
But this is certainly not a problem in France to find something like this. we already have some options / hotspots ahead... (all can be found on leboncoin.fr). feel free to take a look...
it would be easy for us to have / be able to work and live together for someone (native) from the country of origin. it is interesting to be able to handle the administrative matters and to get them arranged. in order to reduce all additional costs, if it is someone from the home country (ie person with their own nationality). You understand... Kind regards
Well in this proposal only a small budget is required (9000@12000E max.)
you can choose which property yourself, we decide together 'according to our preferences & wishes' to the type of offer that can be found on the website of (LeBonCoin.Fr) the only requirement for me is in a certain department region. details will follow later via photographic card.
Everything else is negotiable, for more info & questions, feel free to send an email :/ (MGardeleintje2'apekrul'gmail'punt'com)
Serious candidates (even without any addiction problems)
Thanks

title: 1 to 2 rooms available
description:
Surface: 15mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
An old farmhouse from the 1860s located in Pulderbos-Zandhoven. The house is a terraced house with a backyard, covered terrace and bicycle garage / storage area.
The living space consists of 2 compartments such as a sitting area (lounge) and an area with a dining table. Changes can be made to this (e.g. each person has their own seat or rearrangement of cupboards, subject to respectful agreement). There is one kitchen with refrigerator/freezer, sink and dishwasher. One step lower is a small cellar with a mini oven and microwave, mainly intended as a storage place for food and drinks + cleaning supplies. At the back of the house towards the outside door there is a "laundry room" with washing machine and sink and downstairs toilet, and this room also consists of two parts. Maybe there will be another bath here later. In the kitchen there is a staircase to the top floor, where 1 to 2 rooms are currently available. There is a communal shower room with toilet and rain shower. This house also has an attic that can serve as a storage space. All mentioned areas are communal.
Personal space
Bedroom(s) in progress. In consultation.

title: Cozy Room Available in Modern Apartment
description:
Surface: 15mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
Fully furnished modern  and spacious apartment with a peaceful vibe.
Head upstairs (either by stairs or personal lift) to the main living area, where you'll find a big open space for hanging out, eating, and chilling. Lots of plants add a touch of greenery, and the big windows let in tons of natural light and show off some killer sunset views. There's a projector, record player, guitar and keyboard for movie nights and jam sessions. Two big terraces â€“ perfect for BBQs, gardening, or just kicking back with a drink.
The kitchen is fully loaded with all the latest appliances and plenty of storage space. Upstairs, there's a little bonus room that can be used as an extra storage, plus a handy extra toilet.
Downstairs, you'll find two comfy bedrooms (15 m2 each) for a good night's sleep, along with a modern bathroom with a spacious shower. The warm wood floors downstairs give the place a cozy, homey feel.
This place comes with underfloor heating and cooling to keep you comfy all year round, and solar panels keep your energy bills down. Plus, there's a garage for parking, a spot to store your bikes, and a storage room for all your stuff.
Located just outside the ring of Leuven, with the beautiful Abdij van Park and Sportoase nearby, you get the best of both worlds â€“ peace and quiet, with easy access to the city. There's a bus stop just outside that will take you to Leuven's central station in less than 10 minutes, and the proximity to the highway makes it easy to commute; it's only a 20-minute drive to Brussels.
You will live with a quiet, friendly, cooperative, caring and respectful flatmate. You will be expected to share these same values to ensure a harmonious living environment.

title: Bright, spacious townhouse near Ghent Center for rent
description:
Surface: 15mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Unoccupied rental property for a coliving group (5 bedrooms)
Common parts
The spacious house (renovated in 2014) consists of an entrance hall, a large living room, dining area, equipped kitchen and a beautiful terrace. The high ceilings and high windows provide an extra pleasant feeling! In the basement, there is an extra shower, a toilet and a separate room. On the mezzanine floor there is a smaller bedroom with a view of the terrace. On the 1st floor there are 2 very spacious bedrooms with high ceilings and high windows as well as a separate toilet. One of the bedrooms is equipped with a dressing room. On the second floor you will find the bathroom with bath as well as an extra bedroom with mezzanine, adjoining dressing and a separate toilet.
Ideal for cohousing with 5 people, domicile required.
Personal space
There are 5 bedrooms varying in size from 12mÂ² to 20mÂ². An additional hobby room can be set up in the basement.

We are looking for our future couple or our future roommate to join our happy tribe in a little corner of paradise in Wavre! Only 15 minutes from Brussels (Delta) and 2 minutes from the E411. Our large architect-designed house is surrounded by greenery, with neighbors... goats! Yes, yes, you read that right! Vegetable garden, pond with Koi fish, and a huge garden that goes around the house to always find a spot of sunshine. 
â€¢ A large living room / dining room / kitchen, where a mini jungle and a central fireplace are hidden. 
â€¢ The lab: workspace with desks and washing machine. 
â€¢ The dojo: for yoga, music, Mario Kart evenings and sleeping over friends. 
â€¢ A garage, parking (+-6 spaces), a pond, a vegetable garden, fruit trees... and 3 terraces to sunbathe.
Personal space
Your future room?
A large, bright room with closets, private bathroom and potential to live as a couple (or solo with lots of space!). All available mid-January 2025 (possibly from January 1st if you're in a hurry!).

This cute, sweet, compact studio room is comfortable and practical. Featuring two single (bunk) beds, is a great example of intelligent use of space. Light, bright, and fresh, this studio room also contains massive windows allowing tonnes of natural light, also making the space feel open. The bathroom in this studioroom is also lovely - modern and contemporary, it is spotlessly clean and beautifully fitted out.
Ottenburg is quiet, residential, and open - this property is a very good example of all of this. Great for people that like to walk and be close to nature, this is certainly the place for you. While not super close to the building (in that you would need to grab a ride there) there are a nice selection of restaurants, and if you like to play golf - this area is also another plus for you.

title: Cozy and cozy home
description:
Surface: 18mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
This large detached house consists of 3 full bedrooms and 1 smaller (hobby) room. These are located on the upper floor together with a separate toilet and large landing that can be used as an office. On the ground floor is the open living space with dining room, kitchen and bathroom. In the hall there is also the pantry/technical room and a separate toilet. 
The house is equipped with a dishwasher, washing machine and dryer. All rooms are also equipped with central heating (gas). 
There is a very large parking lot with a beautiful terrace and garden behind the house with a view of meadow and forest. Outside there are also some storage rooms.
Personal space
1 bedroom can be used together with the hobby room as a private space, these are located next to each other at the front of the house on the upper floor.

Us in a nutshell: we are the Boom family. After renovating our house, we found out it was too big, so we started renting out the top floor to students from abroad.
We are friendly, open minded and our children are very used to hosting people from all over the world, as we have been welcoming foreign students since as long as they can remember.
I am a language teacher (I teach Dutch to immigrants) and part time artist (portrait painter and tattoo artist).
My husband is a cook, so there is always food in the house ğŸ˜‹.
Our 14-year old son plays basketball, chess and of course, playstation.
Our girl is 10 and will happily entertain you with her inexhaustible singing, dancing and chattering in something that starts to sound like English.
Oh, and we also have 2 very well mannered cats. ğŸ˜½
These things we like to do togther
We like good vibes and friendly people.
We have busy lives, but we are very happy to hang out in the kitchen or share a cup of coffee or a meal with our homies from time to time.
We offer a nice and comfortable home base from where you can go out, explore and have fun in our beautiful city. Bring your stories home to us :)

title: Room in a co-living residence in Arlon
description:
Surface: 25mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home with private shower
Common parts
The residence is a huge house located in the center of Arlon, 3 minutes walk from the train station. 
12 people live there in a warm and friendly atmosphere. 
The whole house is super equipped with washing machine and dryer, dishwasher, exteriors (garden and terrace) with BBQ, large lounges to relax and even a room with a video projector for your movie nights. 

The charges include wifi, water, electricity, heating, and cleaning of the common areas as well as the possibility of having your room cleaned!
Personal space
The 25m2 room is located on the 2nd floor of the house, it is quiet and bright with 2 large windows. 
There is a wardrobe and a chest of drawers to store your belongings, as well as a desk to work quietly. 
You will also find a large walk-in shower and a sink, the toilets being shared with the rooms on the same landing.

title: Spacious, bright room in 2-room apartment townhouse
description:
Surface: 18mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
The owner lives on the ground floor and this is 1 of 3 apartments full of classic urban charm, but with modern interior. The apartment consists of 2 rooms: 1 small and 1 large. In the small room lives Clarisse, a very sweet, pleasant French student. You share the kitchen/living room and bathroom with her. Although not large in surface area, the high ceilings and the window with a view of the gardens create a spacious feeling in the apartment. In the hallway there are several cupboards that provide plenty of storage space. In the living room there is a Kallax cupboard with 4x4 compartments for extra storage space. In the corner next to the window there is a smaller built-in cupboard where we made the tea/coffee corner. In the kitchen there is a fridge, oven and (fast) heating plate included.
Personal space
The room I am sadly leaving after 3 years is almost as big as the kitchen/living room, with classic moldings and a high window. The large desk is perfect for a home office. The double door is half a large storage space. The wardrobe belongs to the room and 1 smaller cabinet separately too. There is no bed included with the room. The flower chandelier will move with me :)
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A structured, well-organized and clean place.

title: Energy-efficient furnished cohouse for 4 at the Coupure
description:
Surface: 80mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Unoccupied rental property for a coliving group (4 bedrooms)
Common parts
This characterful townhouse on the Coupure offers a beautiful view of the water and the surrounding mansions. The Coupure is in a quiet bicycle street within walking distance of the historic city center. Mobiscore: 9.6/10. There is ample parking space in the street, which is rather exceptional in Ghent. 

The house is fully furnished and ready to move in, but you can also bring your own furniture. 

The ground floor is communal and includes a fully equipped kitchen (renovated in 2024), a cozy dining area (table extendable to 10 people) and an attractive living room with fireplace. 

Outside there is a renovated terrace/city garden (2024) with garden furniture. The house has a full basement with plenty of storage space and a connection for a washing machine. 

Very good EPC score (A): Renovated windows in solar-resistant high-performance glass (incl. fly screens and ventilation grilles); Roof, facade and floor insulation; Renovated high-efficiency natural gas boiler.
Personal space
On the 1st and 2nd floor there are 4 equally large bedrooms (20 mÂ²), each with a shared bathroom (1 with bath, 1 with shower â€“ both with double sink and toilet). All rooms have a warm wooden floor. 

The rooms are solidly furnished. Bringing your own furniture is also possible.

title: Student wanted for housesitting/hospital living on the Left Bank
description:
Surface: 150mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
Spacious student room (17mÂ²) available in a top-notch ninth-floor apartment with incredible views of the Antwerp skyline. Located in the coveted Riverside Tower, designed by Leon Stynen & Paul De Meyer, on the trendy Left Bank.

From the spacious entrance hall, you enter the sun-drenched shared living space with many windows, providing abundant natural light. Here you'll also find the large, open-plan kitchen/diner. There's one modern bathroom with a walk-in shower and, once again, a stunning view, which we'll share!

With Sint Anna beach, the riding school, tennis courts, a marina, and an outdoor swimming pool right on your doorstep, you'll instantly feel like you're on vacation, and all that just a 15-minute bike ride from Antwerp Cathedral!

A coin-operated washing machine and dryer are located in the basement. Bicycle storage is available. A friendly concierge is available.

I travel frequently, so I'm only around occasionally. Are you a master's or doctoral student who enjoys peace and quiet, doesn't smoke, and likes to keep things tidy? Then be sure to get in touch!

Interesting places nearby
Bissegem is not that big, so you can easily walk to the local cafes. 
On the corner of the street you have chip shop Davy - one of the most famous in greater Kortrijk. 
Of course you also have a number of supermarkets in the vicinity.
Access
I live right next to Bissegem station, just across the street. Where you can easily take the direct train to Kortrijk, Ghent and Antwerp. 

Furthermore, you are a 5-minute drive from the motorways with easy connections to Bruges, Ghent, Antwerp, ... You can park for free in front of the door and there are a number of charging stations for those who would drive electric. 

By bike you are in the city centre of Kortrijk in 10 minutes. 

Also interesting to know is that there is a shared car from MobileShare (formerly: Fox Share) and a lot of shared steps right in front of my door.

I live in a spacious and bright triplex apartment with four bedrooms, together with my super sweet cat, Jack.

On the second floor, with a beautiful view of the Rupel River and the nature reserve, you'll find the cozy living room (with air conditioning) and a large roof terrace.

The entrance and fully equipped open-plan kitchen/dining room are on the first floor, where you can also enjoy the same view. Your private room is also located here.

Downstairs, there are three more bedrooms, one of which serves as a dressing room that you can also use.

There is a shared bathroom, two separate toilets, and a laundry room with a washing machine and dryer.

Everything is bright and comfortably furnished.

Jack's territory is limited to the common areas on the upper floors. In the bedrooms, he allows his guests their privacy.

Your room is compact, bright and cozy with some closet space and handy storage drawers under the double bed with a comfortable mattress.

Wander the vibrant streets of Seefhoek and discover a world of hidden gems. The sense of community is palpable here, with friendly locals always welcoming visitors with open arms. title: Gite with stove in De Groene Doening
description:
Surface: 87mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Private unit with shared faciities (1 slaapkamers)
Common parts
Our home is located in rural Poesele, one of the smallest villages in Flanders. The domain is 5250mÂ² and includes a main house, 2 gÃ®tes, workshop, barn, sheep shed, workshop space, orchard, amphibian pool and plenty of space to garden and create a permaculture oasis. Our green paradise offers delicious abundance that we creatively process into all kinds of delicacies. Preserving, drying, fermenting, we experiment with it.
CHECK OUR FACEBOOK PAGE FOR MORE INFO AND BE SURE TO LOOK AT 'EVENTS'. EVERY FIRST SATURDAY OF THE MONTH WE HAVE A DOING DAY WITH AN INFO MOMENT, OPEN JOB DAY AND FUN EVENING ACTIVITY.
Personal space
THE GITE IS CURRENTLY OCCUPIED! IT IS UNCLEAR WHEN IT WILL BECOME FREE. CHECK OUR FACEBOOK PAGE FOR THE MOST CURRENT INFO and visit our website for more information: www.veerenvlam.be/woongemeenschapDeGroeneDoening/ 
BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THE INFO ABOUT OUR DOENING DAYS (either at events on our Facebook page or on our website). EVERY FIRST SATURDAY OF THE MONTH WE HAVE A DOENING DAY WITH AN INFORMATION MOMENT, OPEN DIY DAY AND A FUN EVENING ACTIVITY. THIS WAY YOU CAN ALREADY DISCOVER OUR PROJECT SO WE CAN SWITCH QUICKLY IF THE GITE BECOMES FREE. 

There are 2 gites. This gite (96mÂ²) has a view of the garden and has a wood stove. The living room and kitchen are on the ground floor, the bathroom and bedroom are on the first floor. There are authentic patterned tiles or wooden floors everywhere. 

The rental price for the gites is â‚¬680 respectively. EGW is not included here. Internet/telephony, fire insurance and other common costs are shared by all residents.

De Groene doening is a residential community in Poesele, a small village between Ghent, Deinze and Aalter.

title: Large bright room (25 m2) in a quiet house, Brussels-Jette
description:
Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
The room is located on the second floor of a 250mÂ² house, which sleeps a maximum of four people (there are four rooms, three toilets, and two bathrooms). Currently, there are three Dutch-speaking Belgians. The shared 40mÂ² kitchen is fully equipped. There's a shared 60mÂ² garden (east-facing) with a stone patio and a modern, comfortable patio table. The many plants and flowers, both indoors and outdoors, are well cared for (if you have a green thumb, you're always welcome to lend a hand ;-)). The shared 25mÂ² basement is equipped with a washing machine, dryer, ironing board, iron, and several drying racks; you're welcome to bring a drying rack to your room for privacy. There's also ample storage space in the basement for suitcases and other items. All transport is within 150 m (trams and buses, two metro stations are an 8-minute walk or just three minutes by tram), and the center of Jetteâ€”with all its shopsâ€”is 250 m away. All common areasâ€”the kitchen, bathrooms, toilets, hallway, stairs, etc.â€”are cleaned weekly.
Personal space
The room measures 25mÂ² and is fully furnished: a double bed, a very spacious and practical wardrobe, a private desk, a desk chair, a large sofa with cushions, and carpet. If desired, we can remove some items and place them in the basement, except for the bed, wardrobe, and large sofa. The entire room has parquet flooring and overlooks our quiet one-way street. It's beautifully bright and sunny thanks to four windows. There's hardly any direct contact (our neighbors, who are few in number, always keep their windows blacked out). Strong, unlimited Wi-Fi is available throughout the house. Next to the room is the bathroom, shared by two people. It has a bathtub and a shower and ample space for personal hygiene items and towels. Each resident has a private sink. A toilet (shared between two people) is also located on the same floor. Each room is cleaned biweekly by our regular cleaning lady. She cleans all common areas and two rooms weekly. She cleans the other two rooms the following week.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A structured, well-organized and clean place.

title: Unique co-housing in a villa â€“ spacious room for rent in Deinze
description:
Surface: 15mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
The house is a recently built villa that combines modern comforts with a warm, homely atmosphere. It's located in a quiet, green neighborhood in Deinze, offering plenty of privacy and natural light.

You'll share the house exclusively with me (the owner), although I'm often away for work and often stay with my girlfriend. This means you'll have the house to yourself most of the time, but with the comfort of a shared home.

The communal areas are spacious, welcoming, and well-equipped:

Living room: An open, bright living room with a comfortable seating area, flat-screen TV, and garden views.

Kitchen: Modern, fully equipped kitchen with a cooking island, induction hob, oven, microwave, dishwasher, fridge, and freezer â€“ ideal for preparing elaborate meals or quickly preparing a meal.

Bathroom: Spacious bathroom with a walk-in shower, bath, double sink, and ample storage space.

Separate toilets for added convenience.

Laundry room: With a washing machine, dryer, and ironing facilities.

Garden and terrace: Large south-facing garden with a terrace, garden furniture, and a cozy spot to relax or dine al fresco.

Storage and bicycle shed: Plenty of space for your bike or small items.

Free parking in front of the door.

The entire house is very neat, well-maintained, and equipped with all modern conveniences (underfloor heating, double glazing, gas fireplace, high-speed internet, etc.).
Personal space
The room is spacious, bright, and tastefully decorated, so you'll immediately feel at home. It's located on a quiet floor of the house and offers every comfort for someone who values peace, privacy, and quality.

What you can expect:

A fully furnished room of approximately [number] mÂ²

Equipped with a comfortable bed, large wardrobe, desk with chair, bedside table, and blackout curtains

Plenty of natural light thanks to a large window overlooking the garden or quiet street

Fast Wi-Fi and plenty of power outlets, ideal for studying or working from home

Option to add your own decorative touches

Quietly located in the house, perfect for relaxing after a day at work

This room is more than just a place to sleep â€“ it's your own space in a peaceful, modern setting where you can truly unwind.

A structured, well-organized and clean place.

description:
Type of cohouse
Shared home with private shower
Common parts
Co-housing in Bornem â€“ THUUS â€“ co-housing but different,â€¦ 
Grete, Paul and Rens are still looking for one co-resident. 
If you would like to share this, we would like to thank you very much in advance. 
THUUS is a unique and small-scale project in Bornem, which aims to offer comfortable housing to people who would like to commit themselves to a small living community. 
There is a lot of privacy due to the individual rooms and also the possibility to live together sustainably with fellow residents in the common areas, cook, relax,â€¦ The single-family home has 4 large rooms (+/- 30mÂ²) each with their own bathroom (shower + toilet + furniture with sink). â€˜Co-housingâ€™ means making mutual agreements and being involved in order to be able to live together respectfully with attention to each other's privacy, individuality and freedom. 
One room will be available from October 1. 
Technical advantages: 
- excellent sound and thermal insulation (EPB label A+) 
- efficient ventilation system for a healthy indoor climate 
- use of natural and warm materials 
Shared: 
- entrance hall with guest toilet 
- large living room with open kitchen 
- terrace with garden - bicycle shed / garden house 
- private parking spaces 
Location: 
- close to nature reserve and forest 
- small village center within walking distance 
- train station and lively center at 2km 
- good base to all cities 
Looking for profile: 
- preferably with some life experience and wisdom 
- a certain ecological awareness 
- flexible in dealing, honest and orderly 
- age is not important, but open of heart and mind 
- commitment for long(er) term 
Contact: Dirk Janssens 0475/46.07.36 or dirkjansss@hotmail.com 
Rent price â‚¬ 590 - costs and EGW not included 
Louis Segersstraat 102 in 2880 Bornem â€“ Hingene

title: Looking for a cool housemate for Mechelen (luxury) co-housing
description:
Type of cohouse
Shared home with private shower
Common parts
Our house has four floors with two bedrooms and three studios. Everyone has their own bathroom. The house also has three toilets, a large office space, and a living room with a fireplace, a comfy sofa, a brand-new TV with a Bose system, internet, Netflix, and Apple TV. We have a large kitchen with two large refrigerators and one freezer, all the appliances you need for a three-course meal, a large, handmade designer dining table for eight (ideal for guests), and a cozy round table (also homemade) for four in the morning. We also have a laundry room, a spacious garden with many plants, flowers, and birds, a covered terrace with a lounge chair, and a jacuzzi. There's also an indoor swimming pool with a pool house, sauna, and steam room. We also have green thumbs, and besides strawberries, we're currently busy planting new plants in the garden.

The communal costs are shared by the five residents and amount to â‚¬125 per person. This includes water, gas, electricity, unlimited internet, streaming, and our cleaning lady who comes by every two weeks. You certainly don't have to worry about cleaning products, toilet paper rolls, garbage bags, taking out the trash, or trips to the recycling center. Talk about a hotel service... :)

You can park your bike and car in the driveway.

Oh yeah, and I forgot: We live on a very sociable street with great neighbors! More and more young people are moving in too. What more could you want?

Interested or have questions? Shoot! You're always welcome to come take a look. Coffee or a beer are ready.
Personal space
Welcome to our Mechelen co-housing facility, "Cocoen." We strive to be the most complete and luxurious co-housing in Mechelen. Our house is located just a stone's throw from the station in a quiet neighborhood. We've been co-housing here for three years now, with three to five people (some housemates are often away). A 40mÂ² studio will be available from October 1st/November 1st, 2025.

The room is fully furnished and features a brand-new kitchenette with a microwave and a private ensuite bathroom (also brand-new). The studio costs â‚¬925 per month + â‚¬125 in common fees = â‚¬1050/month. This includes the use of the house, wellness facilities, and all shared appliances. Think of washing machine, dryer, dishwasher, mixers, Nespresso coffee machine, regular coffee machine, oven/microwave, steam oven, toaster, kettle, panini machine, cutlery, glasses... If anything is missing, it will simply be purchased.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A structured, well-organized and clean place.

Do you enjoy playing board games? Do you enjoy going out? Do you enjoy inviting friends over? Chilling on the couch? Swimming laps in the pool in the morning? A sauna or jacuzzi with friends? There are five of us living here together. Three great guys and two women. We're 28, 31, 35, 36, and 41, but we all feel like we're in our twenties. What do we all do? The man of the house is a true McGuyver (he fixes everything that breaks), our youngest is an HR manager at a pharmaceutical company, the newest is an IT security specialist and chef, a marketing/photographer/artist, and we have a flight attendant (she's leaving soon).
These things we like to do togther
With us, you don't rent a room or part of a house; with us, you rent a home, and you decide how you want to live it. We're open, flexible, and we enjoy a good laugh, but we can also talk about serious matters. We don't care what you do, as long as you enjoy it. Everyone is welcome. We're looking for someone who wants to live here for at least one year.

The house is a large townhouse with a living room, dining area, and kitchen on the ground floor. Downstairs in the basement, you'll find additional storage space with a freezer. The room is fully equipped with roller shutters and mosquito nets.

title: 2 rooms for rent
description:
Surface: 13mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
Welcome to this spacious 170 square meter apartment, located on the second floor with a beautiful view of the market of Ternat. Upon entering, you are welcomed by a bright entrance hall with handy storage and a separate toilet. 

The very large living space is perfect for relaxation and conviviality. This space is connected to a modern kitchen, equipped with hobs and a stylish Samsung fridge. The fireplace offers cozy evenings by the fire, and the spacious layout offers enough space for both a TV and a computer. 

For entertainment and relaxation, you can enjoy a 65-inch TV with an extensive range of streaming services, including Netflix, HBO, Apple TV, Prime, Plex, VRT, VTM and more. There is also a PS4. 

The smaller shower room has a toilet and offers all the comfort you need. For sports enthusiasts, there is a rowing machine, an 18kg kettlebell, dumbbells and a bench press with 50kg of weights for the time being. 

This apartment combines luxury and functionality in a perfect balance, offering everything you need for a comfortable and modern life.
Personal space
These two private spaces, each measuring approximately 13 square metres, offer a versatile and adaptable living environment, ready to be furnished to your own taste. 

The first room is equipped with air conditioning, ensuring that this space remains comfortable all year round, regardless of the outside temperatures. 

The second room has a charming terrace, ideal for relaxing moments in the open air. 

Once the layout is more clear, these rooms can easily be furnished with furniture that suits your style and needs.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A cozy space with some clutter every now and then.

Cohousing brings with it a unique dynamic, but it is not as difficult as it may seem. In my opinion, there are a few key aspects that make the experience run smoothly: 

Keeping the Space Clean: The most important thing is to keep the common areas, especially the kitchen and bathroom, clean and tidy. This contributes to a pleasant living environment for everyone. 

Noise: There can be noise pollution when someone wants to go to bed earlier than the other. It is important to be aware of this and respect each other. 

Receiving Visitors: Good communication about receiving visitors is essential. This helps to avoid unexpected situations and ensures that everyone feels comfortable. 

Just like in sales, communication is a crucial factor. It is essential to communicate and understand each other's expectations well, so that living together runs smoothly and pleasantly.

I work in Sales for an IT distribution company, where I have a dynamic outdoor function. I visit my partners every week and work a few days in the office. On average, I work from home about two days a week. 

Personally, I am a big fan of music, media and sports. I try to go to Basic-Fit between three and five times a week to stay fit. My passion for music is also clearly visible in my home environment, where I have a mini-mix table and music production software on my PC. (just bought so still have to learn everything) 

In my free time, I really enjoy watching movies and series, especially sci-fi and fantasy, with the Bose surround sound system. In the weekends, I prepare my meals for the week, and take the time to visit family and friends. Of course, there is also room for a drink and socializing. 

I have experience with cohousing in the past.
These things we like to do togther
The atmosphere in our cohousing community is warm and inviting. We attach great importance to creating a harmonious and orderly living environment together. A movie or series marathon seems fun to me, making a fire etc., cooking / eating together are all possibilities.

title: Rural "inn" cottage with large garden looking for 2 additional residents
description:
Surface: 12mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
This is a caretaker's house (rental) on a former farmstead. There are four house numbers on the farmstead, and we share an entrance garden; each house number is a separate house with a garden.

I'm looking for new housemates for my house. I recently had some WorkAway volunteers over, and they were very pleasant. So I'm looking for more permanent residents.

The front garden has a shaded terrace, entrance hall, living room with a fireplace, kitchen, and small bathroom.

On the first floor, there's a laundry room (washing machine and dryer), a "quiet living room" (also called a library or office).

And one large room with three (separate) single beds.

At the back, there's a large garden with a garden shed and bicycle storage, and a large meadow with an open view that connects to the garden.

There's a vegetable garden in the works, and space for chickens, pasture animals, and WTMG or Airbnb glamping.

I also call it homesteading and see the house as its own entity with its own rhythm to which we all contribute.

The "hostel" aspect is indeed that everyone sleeps together in one room. I also want to coordinate everyone's sleep patterns and am looking for people who agree with this, so that there is a real moment of rest between 10 PM and 6 AM.

I am a single woman of 42 and am looking for other like-minded people.

I would like to clarify that I am absolutely not looking for romance, but rather for housemates who want to actively and equally contribute to the house and to a pleasant, communal atmosphere. Household chores are also shared.
With everyone's consent, a WorkAway volunteer can also be placed in the house to help out with tasks where needed. This way, we also bring the world and travelers into our home, which is very pleasant.

I also love the outdoors and enjoy walking with my two Border Collies, who also live here. During my travels, I really enjoyed living in a different way and was a fan of the mountain huts and monk retreats. The layout of the house offers ample space for quiet and privacy, but everyone doesn't have their own room; there's a shared dormitory. This does require respect, clear agreements, and generosity from the residents, who want to give everyone their own space and peace.

Remote or home working is also possible. The office/library can also become a coworking space where concentration and focus meet a homely atmosphere.
Personal space
The house's layout provides ample space for quiet and privacy, but each resident doesn't have their own room; there's a shared dormitory. This does require respect, clear agreements, and generosity from the residents, who want to give everyone their own space and peace.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A cozy space with some clutter every now and then.

- Space for initiative and creativity, but I want to maintain the style of the house (natural, warm, and serene) and we are fans of decluthering and LEDs-is-more.

The two Border Collies who also live here appreciate animal-friendly people and people who see them as equal housemates, not subordinates.

Something more about your co-residents
I'm a 42-year-old independent woman. I haven't had a partner in decades, and I feel more balanced than ever.

Until 10 years ago, I had an active career in the performing arts, and then I decided to choose organic, eco-friendly, and natural lifestyles instead of artificial/decorative lifestyles. In other words, I've fully embraced being myself and following my own inner voice/rhythm. I eat vegan/vegetarian and organic, love water sports, saunas, (hot) yoga, and my balance bike. An ideal day is an active day outdoors with my two dogs, mountain hikes, and trips in my campervan.

title: the sweet nothing
description:
Surface: 20mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
Welcome to my charming accommodation, part of a former farmhouse, located in Korsele, a peaceful and authentic part of Sint-Maria-Horebeke. The accommodation is just a few meters from a historic village and nestled in a quiet, rural setting. It's the ideal base for beautiful walks or simply to unwind.
The space offers parking, plenty of sunshine, and a peaceful setting where you can fully relax. The train station is just a 10-minute drive away, offering easy access to Ghent or Brussels (note: there's a transfer).
The accommodation is part of the original farmhouse, and you'll often have the entire space at your disposal, as I'm not always there. Occasionally, Airbnb guests come. It's the perfect place for a relaxing stay or a peaceful stopover between your day trips.
Enjoy the charm of the countryside, the space, and the privacy that this part of a former farmhouse offers!
Personal space
You'll have a bedroom at your disposal, complete with a wardrobe, chair, and bed. Internet access is not yet available, but we've requested it. I rent for short periods. It's possible to rent the entire house for a period of two days or more.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A cozy space with some clutter every now and then.

At our farm in Korsele, you can slow down, unwind, and be inspired by the tranquility of the countryside. Everything here breathes organic life: from the surroundings to the way we live and interact with nature. The farm is a peaceful place where I'm not always present, but I do visit occasionally, as do my children. Welcome to our charming accommodation, part of a former farmhouse, located in Korsele, a quiet and authentic part of Sint-Maria-Horebeke. The accommodation is just meters from a historic village and nestled in a peaceful, rural setting. It's the ideal base for beautiful walks or simply to completely unwind.
The space offers parking, plenty of sunshine, and a quiet environment where you can fully relax. The train station is just a 10-minute drive away, offering easy access to Ghent or Brussels (note: there is a transfer).
The accommodation is part of the original farmhouse, and you often have the entire space at your disposal, as I'm not always there. It's the perfect place for a relaxing stay for two or as a peaceful stopover between your excursions.
Enjoy the charm of the countryside, the space, and the privacy that this former farmhouse offers! This place is designed as a time-out, a respite from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, for those who want to slow down and rediscover themselves. A minimum stay of two days is recommended, with a maximum of one month to start, with the possibility of extension depending on your needs and the harmony of the place.

title: Spacious room in a green area in Gentbrugge
description:
Surface: 18mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
Welcome to Bernheimbeuk â€“ a peaceful home surrounded by greenery, a cozy semi-detached house, surrounded by old, stately beech trees. The house has a large garden with a patio and a sunny front terrace â€“ perfect for enjoying peace and quiet, yet not far from the city.

The house has three floors. On the ground floor, you'll find the open-plan living room and kitchen, which flow into each other, as well as a toilet. There's a spacious terrace at both the front and back, with a view of the greenery at the rear.

On the first floor are my bedroom, office, small sitting area, and the bathroom, with both a shower and a bathtub.

The room I'm renting out is on the second floor. It's a spacious and bright room with plenty of privacy. Adjacent to the room is my storage room, which houses the dryer, among other things. So, I'll need to go through it occasionally, but of course, this is subject to consultation.

What we share:

The kitchen and living area on the ground floor

The garden and both terraces

Bathroom (shower, bath, sink, toilet)

Separate toilet

Washing machine and dryer

You'll be living here with me (I'm a yoga teacher and work partly from home), in a peaceful and respectful atmosphere. I'm looking for someone who also appreciates a pleasant, tidy environment and enjoys living together in a peaceful setting â€“ with plenty of room for everyone's own rhythm and lifestyle.
Personal space
The room is located on the second floor, under the eaves, and is spacious and bright thanks to two windows overlooking the trees â€“ you literally wake up surrounded by greenery.

There are wooden floors, and the high ceiling creates an open feeling. The room is furnished with a double bed, desk, clothes rack, and a closet â€“ ready to move in.

Thanks to its location under the eaves, the room stays surprisingly cool in the summer. Because the house is largely built of wood, you can sometimes hear some noise (such as creaking floors or loud talking), but that's part of the charm of a wooden house.
The room is adjacent to my storage room, where the dryer is located. Every now and then, I have to go through there to get something or do laundry â€“ this is always done respectfully and with due consideration.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A cozy space with some clutter every now and then.

I love hiking, yoga, nature, climbing, animals, traveling, andâ€¦ A good conversation or a nice drink together can certainly please me, although the house itself doesn't have to be very social or busy.

I'm someone who likes to take initiative and communicates clearly. I follow my own rhythm and function best when there's mutual respect for space, autonomy, and clear agreements. I'm highly sensitive and value a calm, mindful living environment.

I'm exploring Human Design, where I'm a Manifestor typeâ€”a rare energy type that thrives on freedom, trust, and honesty. This translates into a direct, calm way of living together: I value transparency, preparation, and clear expectations, so that living together can flow naturally.

I love nature, hiking, and exploring new hobbies.

I'm a flexitarian and consciously eco-friendly; I've been a member of a CSA farm for over 10 years and I continue to challenge myself and learn about sustainable choices.

Currently, I'm home a lot and therefore explicitly choose someone who works during the day, so that the rhythm of the house fits well.
These things we like to do togther
The house exudes a warm, natural atmosphere: organic food and ecological products are a given, and the two neighbor cats provide cozy "hello" moments daily. Spirituality or an affinity for it is valued and can add an extra layer of connection. Reciprocity and care for one another are at the heart of living together: everyone contributes and is also welcome to receive.

Cooking or eating together at least once a week is a wonderful way to experience connection. There's room to gradually grow into other shared activitiesâ€”a walk, a quiet evening with tea, a moment of meditation, or other connecting momentsâ€”always based on mutual intuition. Open and direct communication about discomfort or boundaries helps us live together in balance.
This characterizes our residential group
Rest & meditation
Ecoliving

title: Spacious, energetically renovated single-family home
description:
Surface: 18mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Unoccupied rental property for a coliving group (4 bedrooms)
Common parts
Located on the quiet Oud-Heverleestraat in Heverlee, surrounded by greenery, you'll find this spacious, energy-efficiently renovated single-family home less than a 10-minute bike ride from IMEC, the KU Leuven engineering and sports sciences campus, Gasthuisberg and H. Hart hospitals, COLRUYT, ALDI, Kringwinkel, and the Naamse Poort shopping center, providing access to Leuven, the 2030 European Capital of Culture!

Have you graduated and are working, and are you looking for some peace and quiet near bustling Leuven? This is your chance!

The home offers four spacious bedrooms spread over two floors, a bathroom, entrance and stairwell, toilet, kitchen (including a brand-new stove with oven, extractor hood, and a spacious combination fridge-freezer), a laundry room, and, of course, a spacious living room overlooking the terrace and cozy, evergreen garden.

An additional plus for this home is the (also energy-insulated) small summer veranda, the attached garage for many (cargo) bikes or one large car (with a side driveway alongside the house), a storage cellar (approximately half the ground floor), and for those who love sun: in midsummer, the house receives plenty of sun both morning and evening!

Tip! Oud-Heverleestraat is currently a free parking street with no parking ban â€“ so no searching for a "distant" parking space after your busy day!

Available from January 1, 2026.

We're both not home very often, but when we are at the same time, we like to catch up on what's been keeping us busy lately.

Lenny started studying art history again this year. He's very busy with that, so he's mainly stuck in the books and, if he can manage it, he enjoys hitting the road bike.

Maud works four days a week as a carpenter at the Viernulvier Arts Centre in the Vooruit. She also enjoys volunteering with the construction team at De Koer (dekoer.be) and tries to maintain a healthy range of sports activities by running, cycling, or swimming. Her friend also visits regularly, but she's often away because she's there.

We're both quite relaxed about cohousing. We're open to having a cleaner, should the third tenant require one. Ideally, we sit together around the dining table every month to keep our finger on the pulse of whether everyone is happy with how things are going in the house(s).

description:
Surface: 14mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
Starting January 6th, we're looking for a new roommate in our townhouse in the Harmoniewijk neighborhood, 2018 Antwerp. We're a 10-minute walk from the old city center. Public transport stops just around the corner. The first floor features a large living room (with a piano and television), a kitchen/diner with a dishwasher, a toilet, and a storage room with a washing machine and dryer. The kitchen opens onto the terrace overlooking the garden. The second floor has a bathroom with a bath/shower, two sinks, and a separate toilet. A cleaning lady comes weekly to clean the common areas.
Personal space
The bedroom is located on the first floor. It's very quiet and offers plenty of privacy. The room opens onto the terrace and overlooks the garden. It measures two by six and a half meters and is furnished with two wardrobes, a sofa, a bed, a small table with a chair, and a refrigerator. Bed linens can be provided if needed.

A structured, well-organized and clean place.

title: Farmhouse
description:
Surface: 25mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
Secluded in the heart of nature, with endless walks. This is an old farmhouse with double glazing. All communal areas and my own private spaces (bedroom and office) are on the ground floor, which is fully furnished. The dog, an enthusiastic Groenendael, lives with us. So, we expect animal lovers. The house is equipped with almost every comfort. It's completely secluded in nature, far from public transport, so a vehicle is useful. The fairly large garden is primarily an off-leash area for the dog(s). Your private area is on the (attic) floor, which you can furnish yourself.
Personal space
Your private space is part of the (attic) floor. A large room for you, a small room for my daughter who sometimes comes to stay, plus a central common area that you usually occupy alone. Water supply (kitchen, toilet, bathroom) is only available in the common areas on the ground floor. My dog only lives on the ground floor and never comes into your private space. In the photo of your room, you can see moving boxes, but that will all be gone in a flash.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A structured, well-organized and clean place.

I, FranÃ§ois, am retired and live at home permanently. I speak French, Dutch, and English fluently. I'm young at heart, a great music and film lover, highly conscious and spiritual, yet easygoing. I've built up a strong resilience in recent years. I sleep in every morning and have normal afternoons and evenings. My dog, Rolly, is the most important person in my life, and my beautiful teenage daughter comes to stay regularly. We need respect and compassion, which we ourselves provide.
These things we like to do togther
There's always some music playing in the house. For movie nights, you can also choose from my extensive DVD collection. I have my own approach to food and feeding times. Maintaining a clean house together is essential. My dog roams freely on the ground floor and between the house and the garden. Every person is different, every relationship is unique, and so it's our match that will help determine the atmosphere and activities.

Interesting places nearby
Lo-Reninge is officially the least populated municipality in Flanders. Many country lanes wind through meadows and fields. Reninge is a rural village with a few basic shops. More can be found in Lo itself, about eight kilometers away. The coast (De Panne, Koksijde), Bellewaerde Park, Veurne, Diksmuide, Ypres, and northern France are all within a half-hour drive. The beautiful wildlife sanctuary "De Zonnegloed" is very close by.
Access
We live in a secluded natural setting, a 20-minute walk from the village center. The village is poorly served by public transport (only one, somewhat direct, bus line passes through). Claus2You recently started offering car sharing in the village (also one in Lo and two in Vleteren). Train stationsâ€”in Ypres or Diksmuideâ€”are a good fifteen-minute drive away by car.

title: Own room + home
description:
Surface: 12mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
A charming old house.

It's a low-rise house located next to the forest. The large garden leads to the Te Most nature reserve.

The house features a large living room facing the street with an adjoining kitchen. There's also a separate toilet and a bathroom with a bathtub, shower, double sink, and ample storage for two. The garage has space for bicycles and a laundry room with a washing machine. I have a very large garden where I'm building fun projects piece by piece, from vegetable gardens to flower gardens.
Personal space
There's no TV in the living room. We sometimes watch a series on our laptop, but we prefer not to have a screen in the center of the room. There's room for peace, quiet, and creativity. I like to put on some music and make it cozy with the wood stove and candles. I heat with pellets, wood, and air conditioning.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A cozy space with some clutter every now and then.

I'm Gitte, 33 years old. I love nature and sports. Climbing, hiking, yoga, CrossFit, acroyoga, gardening, dancing, singing, and making music. All things I enjoy.
I'm a vegetarian and care about the environment. Because of this, I use eco-friendly detergent and shampoo bars at home instead of plastic bottles.

My 7-year-old son Louie also loves playing outside with sticks and building camps. He stays with me week after week. Louie is super sweet and kind, but he does need some time to adjust. He doesn't let just anyone into his safe space. So he won't be very affectionate or open with others right away. But with time and a secure base, he will blossom.

Warre, my beautiful dog of almost 10 years old, is incredibly sweet and loves playing outside, walking, and swimming.

I love cooking and prefer cooking for others rather than myself ğŸ¥°

Gardening is also possible (or if you'd like to start your own garden project, I'm open to all of that).

And if you need to retreat, there's always space in your own room or our large garden. It will be treated with respect. There's also a quiet/meditation room in the works. I hope to have it finished in February. Children are not allowed here. This space is specifically for internal work. And hopefully also for hosting women's circles or workshops.

title: Looking for a roommate for cohousing for 4 people in Kessel-Lo
description:
Surface: 14mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
On the ground floor, there's a large, shared living room and a sunny kitchen. We also share a bathroom, two toilets, an extra shower, a cellar, and an insulated attic. We also have a lovely little garden where you're free to plant strawberries or other tasty treats (unfortunately, the snails are often too quick for us to enjoy the harvest).

Our house is located in a residential area, a 10-minute walk from Leuven train station, with parks, shops, a Wednesday market, a sports center, and Hal5 nearby.

About us

Arjun's life path brought him to Leuven four years ago, where he was studying for a Master's degree in Education. In his free time, he goes for walks, reads a book, meditates, or goes to a show. For a good conversation, you should definitely ask him!
Tine is a globetrotter with experience in the hospitality industry who is currently retraining as a bicycle repairer (woohoo, free bike maintenance!). She spends her free time seeing friends, cycling, or enjoying an evening in front of Netflix.

Jasper is a training officer at Arktos and a musician. He's taking a year-long Food Forest Gardening course, so if you're looking for tips on edible plants, he's the guy to talk to!

We're looking for someone who will fit in with our home, someone who can live with us warmly and respectfully. We all have our own interests and schedules, but we're always up for a game, a drink, or a chat.
Personal space
The available room is located on the second floor of a terraced house in Kessel-Lo and is approximately 14 mÂ². The rent is â‚¬460, including utilities (water, electricity, heating, and insurance).

A structured, well-organized and clean place.

title: Gentbrugge(Ghent): room @ shared house, quiet, cohousing
description:
Surface: 12mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
**Available from**: April 7th
We are looking for a long-term solution: at least one year.

Deposit: â‚¬920

Your share of the rent: â‚¬490/month for the long term

We will draw up a shared living agreement

WARM ROOM on the first floor, toilet directly opposite the room, high ceiling, SMALL WINDOWS.

FURNISHED: Desk with chair and cupboard.

HI-TECH and HI-COMFORT house.

You can use the SHARED KITCHEN, GARDEN, LIVING ROOM, GARAGE, and all common areas.

You will receive a FREE BICYCLE.

### Short Vibe
Welcome to Cyclo Casa: an established, peaceful cohousing community with international professional housemates, where everyone has their own lives, but a sense of belonging remains important.

Find a Cohouse is all about the right fit between housemates, so a clear introduction (via your profile) is important.
### The House
- Spacious shared house (approx. 200 mÂ² + extra space)
- Garden with deck
- Garage/space for working on bicycles
- Living room with projector (an occasional movie together is fun, but not a "party house")
- Fast, unlimited internet connection (Telenet)
- Fully equipped kitchen + private cupboard/storage space (kitchen/bathroom)
- Fingerprint access at the door
- Recently updated technology (building built in 1911)

### Housemates
- 5 working professionals (approximately 35â€“45 years old), mainly engineers
- Internationally mixed
- Respect for privacy, independence, and clear agreements

### Location: Ledeberg (Ghent)
- Approx. 10-minute bike ride to the city center, university, and Ghent-Sint-Pieters station
- Tram/bus within walking distance (approximately 300 m)
- Shops, fitness center, and green spaces nearby

### House Rules

- Basic cleaning rotation

- Quiet hours after 10 PM

- No smoking indoors, no drugs

- Shoes off in the house

- Reasonable energy consumption

### Ideal cohabitant
- Primarily looking for a long-term place

- Is independent, quiet, and respectful

- Keeps their own space and shared spaces tidy

*Cyclo Casa is completely gas-free: the gas supply is disconnected and the house is heated with an efficient eco-heat pump, a conscious choice for the environment and less geopolitical dependency.

### Interested?
Send a message via the Find a Cohouse message box with a short introduction about yourself (work/study, schedule, why Ghent, what you're looking for in cohousing), so we can see if we're a good fit.
Personal space
### The room

- Private room of approximately 12 mÂ² with wooden floors

- Furnished: comfortable double bed, desk, wardrobe, mirrors

- Warm, with two small windows high up, perfect for those who like to sleep in.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A structured, well-organized and clean place.

- Prefers a quiet home base: respect for privacy, minimal drama, and clear communication.

- Neat and caring: can participate in a simple cleaning rotation and leaves common areas tidy.

- Respects house rules such as quiet hours (after 10:00 PM), no smoking indoors, and generally being considerate of each other.
- Long-term oriented: someone who prefers to "come home" rather than constantly moving.

## What fits Cyclo Casa well:
- Open-minded and internationally oriented, with respect for differences.

- Reasonable with energy/water and shared belongings (living together = caring together).

- Willing to share (kitchen/living space/garden) without it becoming a "social obligation" home: everyone has their own life, and there's always a nice chat every now and then.

- 3 spacious bedrooms of approximately 16 mÂ², with access to a shared shower room
- 1 master suite of approximately 27 mÂ², including a bedroom, dressing room, and private shower room

Welcome to the vibrant and eclectic 2060 neighborhood! This bustling neighborhood is a melting pot of cultures, where more than 100 nationalities live and work together in harmony. Seefhoek, part of the larger 2060 neighborhood, received its unique name in 1860, after two local beers, Seef and Eel. Today, the area boasts a rich and diverse culinary scene, inspired by the four corners of the globe. From aromatic Indian spices to delectable Middle Eastern delicacies, Seefhoek is a foodie's paradise.

Stroll through the lively streets of Seefhoek and discover a world of hidden gems. The community spirit is palpable here, with friendly locals always welcoming visitors with open arms. Whether you want to immerse yourself in the vibrant culture, indulge in retail therapy, or simply soak up the enchanting atmosphere, Seefhoek has something for everyone.

title: Beautiful room available in cohousing Mortsel
description:
Surface: 18mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
The recently renovated house is located on a quiet street in a green neighborhood, near the Frijthout landscape park. Public transport (tram, bus, train), two cycle paths, shops, and restaurants are easily accessible.
Ground floor (fully shared): hall with guest toilet, living room with built-in kitchen, utility room, front and back garden with covered patio. Bicycle storage in the front garden is planned.
First floor: a bathroom with shower and a separate toilet. There is also a small room that can be used for reading, crafts, receiving private visitors, working from home, etc.
Second floor: a bathroom with bath/shower and an additional small room.
Basement: two dry cellar spaces

Storage attic: easily accessible via the staircase in the hallway
Personal space
On the first floor, there are two private rooms, each 18.5 mÂ², with blinds and a sink with a cabinet.

On the second floor, there are two private rooms, each 16.5 mÂ², with roller shutters and a sink with a cabinet.

The large, unfurnished room on the first floor at the back is still available; all other rooms are currently occupied.

We currently have three women and would love to meet a fourth housemate.
Eva is an enthusiastic young woman in her early thirties with a disability for which she receives the necessary support.
During the week, she is independently active outside the home, working at a social bistro, singing in two choirs, pursuing a creative career at art school, and cooking, washing, and maintaining her part of the house together with family help.
She has consciously chosen to live with someone.
Amber, 22, enjoys both quiet activities (reading, movies, tea, walks) and more active pursuits (nights out, board games, etc.). She is studying applied psychology, previously worked with people with disabilities, and as an extra source of income, she takes care of pets.
Marte, 22, works as an educational psychologist in a residential care center. She enjoys music, outings, and a cozy home.
These things we like to do togther
The house aims to be a welcoming living space for up to four independent women.
We share the ground floor and meet regularly, for example, by eating together, chatting, playing board games, and so on.

At the same time, there's respect for everyone's privacy, allowing everyone to live and develop their own lives.

title: Room available in spacious house near Leuven!
description:
Surface: 32mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home with private shower
Common parts
The house is located in Heverlee, close to Gathuisberg (1km) and IMEC (2km). There is a bus stop at 100m with connections straight into Leuven city center and train station.
On the ground floor there is a hall with toilet and cloakroom, an open, fully equipped kitchen with a big island, a spacious dining area and a view to the garden. The garage offers parking to your bike, scooter, or motorcycle, and storage for groceries.
For cars, there is ample parking space in front of the house.
On the first floor there is a common living area with a view to the countryside behind the house, and your studio behind a sliding door: separate toilet, a bathroom with bath, shower, and two basins, and a large bedroom.
On the second floor there is another bedroom with private bathroom, and a fitness room with strength and cardio equipment.
For long term storage, an attic is available as well.
Personal space
The studio is spacious and has its own toilet and separate bathroom with bath, shower, and two basins. It is located on the street side of the house and has big windows that take in a lot of light. There are ample electrical outlets and a separate Ethernet/Coax outlet.
The entire wall and ceiling surface has been repainted last July in pastel green.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A structured, well-organized and clean place.

Hello!

Due to my departure, I'm looking for a new tenant for our cohouse.

The house is ideally located in a residential area in Heverlee, just outside Leuven itself, but Leuven city center and Leuven train station are easily accessible by bike or bus (there's a bus stop close to the house).

The house has two floors, five rooms, a bathroom, kitchen, living room, and a beautiful garden (perfect for enjoying in the summer!).

There are five of us in the cohouse; we're between 29 and 38 years old and working. Everyone has the space to pursue their own activities, but there's always the opportunity to do something together ğŸ˜Š We're preferably looking for someone who is already working or looking for work, calm, and sociable. Personal space
The room is approximately 15 mÂ². There's plenty of room for a bed, desk, and wardrobe. Shelving units are already integrated into the room's structure. It's located on the second floor and is the only room on this floor, so you'll have a bit of space to yourself.

A structured, well-organized and clean place.

title: Cohousing house with garden
description:
Surface: 20mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
We're looking for a new housemate for Yaelle and our sweetest four-legged friends, looking for the coziest cottage nestled in nature, pure tranquility, yet very close to the city (tram stop and train station within walking distance, Ghent about a 20-minute bike ride away). Five years ago, I started renovating my dream cottage just outside Ghent. My beloved home is now finished and ready for adventures, big or small. For years, I've dreamed of venturing out into the wide world indefinitely, so there's a room available in my beautiful cottage. We're looking for someone open-minded and kind, even to animals, who can keep my place warm.

This is a fully renovated semi-detached house with two bedrooms and an attic room serving as a dressing room (to share), a large, bright living room, a bathroom with a bath/rain shower, a large open-plan kitchen overlooking the garden, a laundry room, and last but not least, a lush garden with a cozy terrace for relaxing, a garden shed, and your own chickens. You can store your bike in the dry shed next to the garden shed. The gate leads to a passageway next to the house, where you can place the trash cans to prevent unpleasant odors.

This house is incredibly cozy. We love music, delicious, preferably vegetarian, food, philosophizing, watching movies, but also doing our own thing. Friends are welcome to come hang out with us occasionally (PARTYTIIIIME), but preferably not too often, because we also appreciate some peace and quiet in our busy lives.

Does this sound like music to your ears or are you curious? Don't hesitate to contact us and come take a look. This is a cohousing contract, the rent is â‚¬450/person (excluding costs, which are shared monthly).

title: Baeyenshof cohousing, https://www.baeyenshof.be/
description:
Surface: 60mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Private unit with shared faciities (2 slaapkamers)
Common parts
Living in a green oasis in the heart of the village. The benefits of the town center with the tranquility of nature all around. This is what we offer with the Baeyenshof cohousing project.

Our target group consists of people aged 55 and over who want to live together and live privately in nine newly built private apartments.
The entire cohousing community has a shared large apartment where people can meet each other and visitors. It is also fully furnished with a large living area and kitchen, two bedrooms for visitors, a bathroom, and a terrace. The new building will use a heat pump for heating and generate electricity from solar panels. Car sharing is an option.

The project will be completed in 2026. The first tenants are expected to move in in January 2027.
Personal space
Each apartment is fully furnished with its own living space with kitchen and terrace, bedroom, bathroom and storage room.
What can you expect in terms of cleanliness?
A structured, well-organized and clean place.

I also value honesty and openness.

Welcome to the Pastizal, the pasture. Referring to the future area â€œSlachthuissiteâ€ on the Dam in Antwerp. title: Large room for rent in a house with a garden in Gentbrugge
description:
Surface: 20mÂ²

Type of cohouse
Shared home
Common parts
The house is almost fully equipped. However, some space could be made available for a kitchen shelf for food storage.
We share the hallway, living room, dining room, kitchen, basement, separate toilet, bathroom, and a charming little garden. From the garden, you can enter the local park through a gate. This is an idyllic little park with beautiful oak trees and a small pond. It's a very quiet, rarely visited park. So, from our garden, we look out onto a lot of greenery :)
Personal space
The room I'm offering is quite large and partially furnished. It already has a bunk bed and two built-in wardrobes. There's still plenty of space to set up a desk or table if desired. The room faces the street but overlooks a beautiful pine tree, which also offers a bit more privacy. The house is located in a quiet neighborhood near the Gentbrugse Meersen, yet within easy cycling distance of the city center. Good train, tram, and bus connections, and supermarkets are within walking distance.
P.S.: I haven't measured the exact size of the room yet. The photos give you an idea.

description:

Type of cohouse

Common parts
PERSONAL AREA:

A smaller room on the south side of the garden in our co-house in Drongen Luchteren will become available in mid-February 2026 (approximately 13/02/2026).
First floor, approximately 8 mÂ².
Very sunny and quiet room, with a lovely view of the terrace and garden.
Single bed, desk, and extra storage space on the landing.
Washing machine and dryer available for use in our garage by arrangement.

COMMON AREA:

Upstairs toilet/shower room for co-housers. Two showers are provided.
Furnished kitchen downstairs.
Front and back garden.
Plenty of free parking in front of the door in a safe, dead-end street.

Bicycle storage.
Supermarket, bakery, and pharmacy nearby. The house is located in a very quiet neighborhood with a lovely front and large back garden, two south-facing terraces, perfect for enjoying the nice weather. It's easily accessible by public transport and also easily accessible by bike to Ghent city center (approximately 8 km).
Personal space
The layout of the house and rooms guarantees absolute privacy. A quiet cul-de-sac, so you'll have a great night's sleep!

A cozy space with some clutter every now and then.
